duties_responsibilities.duty: Serve as a key contact point between the sponsor and the investigational site for Investigational Product Preparation Instructions (IPPI) training.
Focus on IPPI review and training/implementation of IP preparation steps for all compounds requiring training plans.
Contribute to continuous process improvement, training, and mentoring for IPPI.
Perform Site Manager (SM) and/or Trial Manager (TM) tasks as described in GCO procedural documents for ED&CP studies.

education_certification.credential: BS degree in Pharmacy, Pharmaceutical Sciences or a related field, with 2-3 years of experience, or a MS, Pharm. D. or other advanced degree in Pharmacy, Pharmaceutical Sciences or a related field with at least 1-2 years of experience. Pharmacist License preferred.
